    Singleton Static class that holds all the objects that need to be accessible from everywhere.

    Extends ServerSide.Component to represent a drawable canvas area.

    Represents a chat component in a graphical user interface, extending ServerSide.Component.

    Represents a int picker component, extending the ServerSide.Component class.
    class 
    ServerSide.Component
    Represents a basic graphical component for a user interface.
    class 
    ServerSide.DuplicateUserException
    Custom exception for handling scenarios where an attempt is made to create or register a user that already exists.
    class 
    ServerSide.Login
    Manages the user interface for login and registration activities.
    class 
    ServerSide.MessagePane
    Represents a message pane component, which extends ServerSide.Component.
    class 
    ServerSide.ScoreBoard
    Displays a scoreboard using sliders to show the highest scores dynamically, which extends ServerSide.Component.
    class 
    ServerSide.StrokeSizePicker
    A component for selecting stroke sizes visually, extends ServerSide.Component.
    class 
    ServerSide.User
    Represents a local user during system runtime.
    class 
    ServerSide.UserList
    Manages a list of users including operations to add, retrieve, and update users in the system and their corresponding data in the database.
    class 
    ServerSide.UserPane
    A component that manages and displays a list of connected users, extends ServerSide.Component.
    class 
    ServerSide.WordList
    Manages a list of words, including loading them from a database, and provides functionality for word validation and selection.
    class 
    ServerSide.WordPicker
    A component that handles the display and interaction of word choices, extends ServerSide.Component.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerSide

      public ServerSide()

  • Method Details

    • setup

      void setup()
      Sets the properties of the GUI and initializes the different GUI components.

    • draw

      void draw()
      Main draw loop of the game. Updates current UI and responds to incoming client messages. Checks for game status and handles serverside user heartbeat.

    • handleIncomingMessages

      public void handleIncomingMessages()
      Handles incoming messages from the clients and redirects them to the corresponding methods.

    • writeToClients

      public void writeToClients(String message)
      Sends a formatted message to all clients in a specific format.
      Parameters:
      message - The raw message to be sent to the server.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts a new game and resets canvas.

    • endGame

      public void endGame(String username)
      Ends the current game and stops canvas inputs. Attributes points to the drawing user based on duration of game and a fixed amount to the guessing user. Updates the user stats and sends a message to the clients, telling them who won the game. Updates the canvas to show the restart button.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user that guessed the word correctly.

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message, boolean isCritical)
      Displays a message to the user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed.
      isCritical - Indicates if the message is critical.

    • showWordPicker

      public void showWordPicker()
      Shows the wordpicker in the canvas.

    • controlEvent

      public void controlEvent(controlP5.ControlEvent theEvent)
      Handles control events triggered by the user interface, such as button clicks. This method routes the actions based on the source of the event, identified by the controller's name.
      Parameters:
      theEvent - The control event captured by the system.
